etymology.description: 功(功) (gōng, "achievement; skill") + 夫(夫) (fū, "man; master") = skill or art of a master, referring to martial arts or any skill acquired with effort and patience.
etymology.interpretation: The term 功夫(功夫) (gōngfu) initially referred to any skilled practice requiring time and dedication. Today, it is broadly associated with Chinese martial arts, highlighting the mastery and effort involved.

examples.chinese: 他练习功夫(他練習功夫)，追求内心平静(追求內心平靜)。
examples.pinyin: Tā liànxí gōngfu, zhuīqiú nèixīn píngjìng.
examples.english: He practices kung fu, pursuing inner peace.

examples.chinese: 学好功夫(學好功夫)，可以提高自信(可以提高自信)。
examples.pinyin: Xué hǎo gōngfu, kěyǐ tígāo zìxìn.
examples.english: Mastering kung fu can boost self-confidence.
